1. I notice that there are a lot more people of color as players than people of color as head coaches.

2. I wonder why Major League Baseball has significantly less players of color than any of the other leagues listed here.

3. My community and I are affected by this because it shows that while people of color can become sports players, it is unlikely for people of color to have a management/coaching position in these sports. This thus results in less people of color wanting to be in a coaching position and will keep this data relatively static.

4. This graph is showing the amount of people of color as players/athletes and the amount of head coaches of color. A catchy name for this might be "Are major sports leagues actually diverse?"

4.
ace_sentences: In the data, there are more players of color than head coaches of color.

A coaching position is a management position.
If it is unlikely that people of color have a coaching position, then fewer people of color want to have a coaching position.
If fewer people of color want to have a coaching position, then the data will remain relatively static.
